items.title: S&P 500, Nasdaq end higher on Amazon-OpenAI deal; Fed path forward grows murky
items.description: Artificial intelligence deals propelled the S&P 500 and Nasdaq higher on Monday, with Amazon's $38 billion agreement with OpenAI and Nvidia's chip allocation boosting tech stocks.  Despite a foggy monetary policy outlook due to scarce economic data and a government shutdown, market sentiment was supported by positive trade news and dovish Fed commentary.

items.title: GIFT Nifty down 40 points; here's the trading setup for today's session
items.description: Indian equities closed modestly higher as investors adopted a cautious stance amidst mixed global signals. Key earnings reports from major companies are due today, with market sentiment expected to be influenced by the ongoing earnings season and potential developments in the India-US trade deal. The India VIX rose, indicating increased trader caution and potential market volatility.

items.title: Stocks in news: SBI, M&M, Airtel, Adani Enterprises, Power Grid
items.description: Indian markets showed stability, consolidating after October's gains. Corporate earnings and trade developments are now key drivers. Titan reported strong Q2 profit growth, while Bharti Airtel saw a significant jump. Vodafone Idea received relief from the Supreme Court. Cipla is acquiring Inzpera Healthscience, and Adani Power is pursuing international arbitration for payment disputes.

items.title: Asian stocks edge lower after Wall Street gains
items.description: Asian stocks opened lower Tuesday, diverging from Wall Street's tech-driven gains fueled by AI enthusiasm. Traders eyed central bank decisions and economic data, with concerns over high valuations and the Fed's policy outlook persisting despite strong equity market performance this year.

items.title: BSE shares surge as traders build fresh bullish F&O bets
items.description: BSE shares surged on Monday following Sebi's assurance against a ban on weekly options, encouraging fresh bullish derivative positions. The stock jumped 4% and ended 2.6% higher, with analysts citing trader confidence and bullish technical indicators for potential further upside. This relief comes after recent pressure due to regulatory uncertainty.

items.title: Nifty Next 50 poised for catch-up rally as valuations turn attractive
items.description: Cost-conscious investors can consider the Nifty Next 50 index fund for value in large-cap stocks, offering higher earnings growth potential and reasonable valuations. This index provides diversification with exposure to unique industries and lower concentration risk compared to the Nifty 50, making it an attractive option for long-term investors.

items.title: A month without data muddles the economic picture in the US
items.description: The US economy faces unprecedented uncertainty due to a prolonged government shutdown, halting crucial economic data. This data blackout, the longest in history, leaves economists and policymakers like the Federal Reserve struggling to assess the labor market's health and inflation trends, akin to driving in heavy fog.

items.title: Warburg in talks to sell its 26% stake in IndiaFirst Life
items.description: Warburg Pincus is in advanced talks to sell its 26% stake in IndiaFirst Life Insurance for approximately ₹10,000 crore. The private equity firm is approaching global strategic investors and PE funds for the exit, with bids expected in early December. Barclays is managing the deal, aiming for a March 2026 signing.

items.title: Are PSU banks entering a new bull phase after stellar Q2 results?
items.description: Public sector banks are performing strongly. Their September quarter earnings have boosted investor confidence. Bank of Baroda and Indian Bank saw significant gains. Analysts note improved valuations and declining NPAs. This resilience makes PSU banks an attractive investment. Their performance outshines private banks and the broader market over the last six months.

items.title: Brookfield lines up $12 bn for green energy in Andhra as it eyes $100 bn India expansion by 2030
items.description: Brookfield Asset Management will invest twelve billion dollars in Andhra Pradesh's renewable energy sector over the next three years. This is the largest overseas commitment to India's green energy sector. The global firm also plans to establish a township and multiple hotels under its Leela brand.

items.title: Digital units of public banks to undergo review
items.description: The government is gearing up for a comprehensive review of digital banking units with the goal of amplifying financial inclusion and simplifying customer interactions. These innovative units will aid in efforts such as regular customer verification and reclaiming unclaimed assets.

items.title: One Mobikwik Systems Q2 Results: Net loss widens YoY to Rs 29 crore; revenue down 7%
items.description: One Mobikwik Systems Q2 Results: Mobikwik reported a sharp drop in Q2FY26 profit to ₹28.6 crore from a net loss of ₹3.3 crore a year earlier, while revenue slipped 7% YoY to ₹270.2 crore, reflecting weaker operational performance.

items.title: Hitachi Energy India shares surge 14% as Q2 profit jumps fourfold, margins expand sharply
items.description: Hitachi Energy India shares jumped up to 14% to ₹20,399 after the company reported a stellar Q2FY26 performance, with net profit surging 406% YoY to ₹264.4 crore and PAT margin expanding to 13.8% from 3.4% a year ago.

items.title: Mutual funds bet on 10 high-growth stocks rallying up to 85% — Is your stock on the list?
items.description: Investors often pay close attention to where major institutional players, particularly mutual funds (MFs), are allocating their capital, as these investors typically commit funds only after thorough research and due diligence. When the companies they support also deliver robust profit growth, it becomes an added advantage for retail investors. In the September quarter, around 51 companies reported year-on-year profit growth of 25%, and notably, mutual funds increased their holdings in these companies compared to the previous quarter. Many of these stocks have also rewarded investors with strong price returns in CY25, reflecting both solid fundamentals and market confidence. Among them, we spotlight the top 10 performers, which have recorded gains of 25–85% so far this year. (Data Source: ACE Equity)

items.title: Ambuja Cements shares rise marginally after Q2 PAT surges 268% YoY, brokerages hike target price. Should you buy?
items.description: Ambuja Cements' share price saw a marginal uptick on Tuesday after the company reported a  268% YoY surge in Q2 FY26 net profit to Rs 1,766 crore, driven by record volumes and strong cost control. Brokerages, including Motilal Oswal, JM Financial, and Elara Capital, raised target prices, citing improving margins and a profitability outlook.

items.title: NSE holidays 2025: Is the stock market closed or open on Nov 5 for Guru Nanak Jayanti 2025?
items.description: Indian stock markets, including NSE and BSE, will remain closed on Wednesday, November 5, 2025, for Guru Nanak Jayanti. Trading across all segments will be suspended, marking the only market holiday in November, while MCX will remain shut for the morning session and reopen in the evening.

items.title: FIIs dump Indian consumer stocks despite tax cut boost
items.description: Foreign investors reduced their stakes in Indian consumer stocks during the September quarter, despite a consumption tax cut aimed at boosting spending. While retail sales saw an 8.5% increase during the festival season, economists caution that pent-up demand and ongoing economic headwinds like slow income growth may temper the outlook.

items.title: F&O Radar| Deploy Bear Put Spread in Nifty to benefit from volatility amid short buildup
items.description: Nifty held above 25,700 despite weakness in futures, while rising India VIX and FII short buildup signal caution. ICICI Securities’ Jay Thakkar suggests deploying a Bear Put Spread strategy, with a 41-point outflow, breakeven at 25,759, and maximum profit of 590 points below 25,700.

items.title: Fitch Ratings upgrades outlook on Adani Ports and Adani Energy to 'Stable'
items.description: Fitch Ratings has taken a positive step by upgrading the outlook for Adani Ports and Adani Energy Solutions to Stable. This decision underscores the Adani Group's impressive access to a wide range of funding options.

items.title: 3M India shares zoom 13% after reporting 43% YoY surge in Q2 PAT, ICICI Securities raises target price
items.description: Shares of 3M India surged 13% to Rs 34,700 after reporting a 43% year-on-year rise in Q2FY26 profit to Rs 191 crore. Revenue grew 14%, led by broad-based sales across all segments. ICICI Securities raised its target to Rs 35,700, citing strong auto demand and government-led infrastructure momentum.

items.title: Thangamayil Jewellery shares rise 19%, up 50% in 4 sessions. What’s fuelling the sharp surge?
items.description: Thangamayil Jewellery surged 19% to a record high of Rs 3,089 after posting a strong turnaround in Q2FY26 and record sales in October. The company reported a net profit of Rs 58.5 crore versus a loss last year, while revenue jumped 45% YoY. October revenue crossed Rs 1,000 crore for the first time, driven by festive demand.

items.title: For risk-takers with slightly long-term perspective: 7 mid-cap stocks from different sectors with an upside potential of up to 45%
items.description: While it is at the index level, there are indications that mid-caps are making a serious attempt at a comeback. There is, however, a mix of head and tailwinds. As an investor, what should you do in such a scenario? We say it is time to increase your risk-quotient. Why? Because you need to make a distinction between tariff-related politics and macro-economic reform. The direct impact of politics will pass, but the impact of macro reforms lasts much longer. So be bullish. But exercise caution.

items.title: 4 stocks Ashish Kacholia trimmed in September quarter amid Rs 2,740 crore portfolio reshuffle
items.description: Veteran investor Ashish Kacholia pared stakes in a handful of portfolio companies during the September 2025 quarter, signaling selective profit-taking after a strong multi-year run in several of his bets. Kacholia currently holds 48 publicly listed stocks worth over Rs 2,739 crore. In the latest quarter, he marginally trimmed his holdings in Dhabriya Polywood, Fineotex Chemical, Xpro India, and Brand Concepts, as part of a broader realignment across his diversified portfolio spanning manufacturing, infra, and specialty chemical plays.

items.title: Hero MotoCorp shares fall 3% as October sales drop 6%; exports jump 43%
items.description: Hero MotoCorp shares slipped 3% to Rs 5,382 after reporting a 6.3% decline in October sales for FY26, driven by lower motorcycle and domestic sales. However, scooter and export volumes rose sharply. Citi retained its Buy rating with a Rs 6,100 target, citing festive demand and solid retail momentum.

items.title: Vodafone Idea shares in focus after SC order paves way for AGR relief
items.description: Vodafone Idea shares: The Supreme Court has allowed the Centre to reassess telecom companies’ pending AGR dues beyond FY 2016-17, clarifying that the review isn’t restricted to that year alone — a move that could offer wider relief to the debt-laden firms.

items.title: Cipla shares in focus after deal to acquire Inzpera Healthsciences for Rs 111 crore
items.description: Cipla shares: Cipla has agreed to acquire a 100% stake in Inzpera Healthsciences, making it a wholly owned subsidiary, as part of its strategy to strengthen its presence in the paediatric and wellness segment.

items.title: Japan’s factory activity hits 19-month low as demand slumps
items.description: Japan’s manufacturing activity shrank at the fastest pace in 19 months in October, as weakness in the automotive and semiconductor industries deepened. The S&P Global Manufacturing PMI slipped to 48.2 from 48.5 in September, marking the fourth consecutive month below the 50.0 threshold that separates expansion from contraction. (Source: Reuters)
